Posted By: James_Kernaghan (1/27/2013 4:16:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Three amazing options, yet never a dead card. Most of the charms have options that have the power of CMC 1 spells, but all three of these are easily at least on the power of CMC 2-- more damage than [Lava Spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Spike) and at instant speed, [Double Cleave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Double Cleave) (a CMC 2 spell) and potentially another nice combat trick that can be doubled by saving your PERMANENTS from most board wipes. This doesn't really need to be said, but Boros Charm is incredibly powerful, and I love it.
posts.html:

This doesn't really need to be said, but Boros Charm is incredibly powerful, and I love it.

Posted By: Professor_Superman (1/28/2013 9:17:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
After having played both with and against this card extensively over pre-release weekend, I can safely say:  
  
What the hell, Wizards. Was this not playtested? This card is one of the single most broken cards in the history of magic. IN WHAT IS ABOUT TO BE STANDARD, I've been turn *3* killed because of this card at least 4 times in the 6 games I played against my friend's new white/red/blue deck.  
  
I don't understand how they print a card as an uncommon that should be a rare at minimum. It still would have been the best charm of the block if it only did 3 damage to target player and only granted first strike.
posts.html:
After having played both with and against this card extensively over pre-release weekend, I can safely say:

What the hell, Wizards. Was this not playtested? This card is one of the single most broken cards in the history of magic. IN WHAT IS ABOUT TO BE STANDARD, I've been turn 3 killed because of this card at least 4 times in the 6 games I played against my friend's new white/red/blue deck.

I don't understand how they print a card as an uncommon that should be a rare at minimum. It still would have been the best charm of the block if it only did 3 damage to target player and only granted first strike.
